Sometimes we do it because it helps our job a lot more (some companies just do not provide), and things might be urgent. (buying a test pen or putty and back claim later. Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 25 Dec 2018I think it depends on the type of work and your dedication (albeit sometimes not by choice). It is a commonplace for educators to splurge on stationaries, children's day/youth's day gifts, small tokens as rewards or for student's birthday -- all of which not claimable. If work related materials refers to computer/chair/table then that's quite unreasonable. You should exercise personal discretion when buying for yourself or for your colleagues.0 comments0
